title: Privacy Policy
text: Your privacy is important to us. This policy outlines how this website collects, uses, and protects your information.

title: Privacy Policy
text:
Information Collection and Use
We use Google Analytics, a web analytics service provided by Google, LLC. (“Google”). Google Analytics uses cookies to help analyze how people interact with this content, including tracking which sections are accessed most frequently. Information generated by cookies about your use of our website (including IP address) will be transmitted to and stored by Google on servers in the United States.
Google will use this information solely for evaluating webpage usage, compiling usage reports to enhance the educational effectiveness of the content, and providing related services.
You may refuse the use of cookies by selecting the appropriate settings in your browser.

title: Privacy Policy
text:
Personal Information
We do not collect personally identifiable information through Google Analytics. Any personally identifiable information, such as your name and email address, would only be collected if voluntarily submitted for specific educational purposes (e.g., feedback or course-related inquiries). We will never sell or distribute your personal information to third parties.
For any questions or concerns, please contact [FILL THIS IN]

title: Subpage A from Dropdown 1
text: This page is written like any other page, but is found in a drop down menu!

title: Page 2
text:
This is a sample page that’s a bit more fancy. It has a subtitle, and the last date the page was modified appears using date-modified: last-modified in the preamble of this page.
Just like in RMarkdown, I can add:
If you’re using RStudio, the visual mode (see button on the top left) can be helpful with adding extra features!

title: Page 2
text:
More cool features
I really like to add drop-down menus for teaching! These are called “callout” blocks. In visual mode, you can find them under the “Insert” drop down menu, near the bottom.






This is a drop-down menu. Click it to read more!





Surprise!



I often imbed YouTube videos in my webpages, too. You can easily add them using .

title: Subpage B from Dropdown 2
text: This page is also written like any other page, but is found in a second drop down menu!

title: Simple Quarto Website Template
text:
This is a Quarto Website template that I like to use. It is easily modified, but contains a few important features that I often want to repeat!

The jekyll template (which can be pesky when working with GitHub pages) is already disabled
Templates for drop-down menus are provided
Google Analytics is set up for you to use, along with a pop-up for user consent! To use Google Analytics:

Sign up for a Google Analytics Account
Create a stream for this website
Add your Google Analytics Measurement ID (G-XXXXXXXXXX) to two lines of code found in privacypolicy/google-analytics.html.
Update your contact information at privacypolicy/privacy.qmd

If you don’t want to track your analytics, remove the last two lines of code in _quarto.yml (include-in-header: privacypolicy/google-analytics.html and include-after-body: privacypolicy/custom-popup.html can be deleted)

This page (index.qmd) is your Home Page.
